cause.description:
The Mid-Fairfield AIDS Project (MFAP) was founded in 1987 as an initial response to HIV/AIDS by individuals from a variety of local organizations in co-operation with the Norwalk Health Department and Norwalk Hospital. Now, fifteen years later, Mid-Fairfield AIDS Project provides an array of services and programs.
The Mid-Fairfield AIDS Project is committed to providing quality services in it's efforts to bring much needed care, information, and assistance to those living with, and affected by, HIV/AIDS.
1. MFAP believes that in order to effectively respond to people living with HIV, the program must be comprehensive and address the complexity of the infection, the range of clients’ experiences, and the need of the diverse group.
cause.mission: to providing quality services in it's efforts to bring much needed care, information, and assistance to those living with, and affected by, HIV/AIDS.
cause.name: Mid Fairfield AIDS Project
